intro: Sida fallax var. kauaiensis, commonly known as Kauai sida, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This shrub typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical, with a rough texture and a distinctive blue-green color. The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting native pollinators.
